result.execSummary:
The defendant Norris T. Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Norris T. Powell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Norris T. Powell was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.     
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Parker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 324 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Firearm to be destroyed.
PSI from DOC had Atty Rose name on it, PDOAC for Atty Parker in system, PSI given to Atty Parker.
from DE

PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 8/27/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
